org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.map
Class AttributeMapProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.map.AbstractMapProcessor
          org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.map.AttributeMapProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class AttributeMapProcessor
extends AbstractMapProcessor

Change keys in an incoming Map, to one or more new keys using a supplied mapping.

The configured Map contains key names, and the new (key) values they are to be mapped to.

Note that a given key may be mapped to multiple new keys, by supplying a List (of new key names) in place of a single value. Note also that the mapping may not preserve ordering of mapped keys in the output record - for example a mapped field in an OrderedMap will result in a new entry being appended to the end of the existing fields (with the original entry having been removed)

Since:
Introduced Post 3.2.1
Author:
Eddy Higgins

setRemoveMappedKeys

public void setRemoveMappedKeys(boolean deleteMappedKeys)
If true, then delete original key:value pairings if a mapping exists.
Existing keys which are not contained in the mapping are not modified.
The default is true - i.e. delete mapped keys

Parameters:
deleteMappedKeys -

setRetainMappedEntriesOnly

public void setRetainMappedEntriesOnly(boolean retainMappedEntriesOnly)
If true, entries in the original map which are not referenced in the mapping, will no longer exist in the outgoing record.

The default is false - i.e. unreferenced entries will pass to the output record unmodified.

Parameters:
retainMappedEntriesOnly -

processMap

public java.lang.Object[] processMap(java.util.Map incoming)
                              throws RecordException
Map key names in an incoming Map record, according to the supplied Map.
This will check the record for each key in the supplied map. If the key exists, the value will get a new key within the record, as determined by the map's value for that key.

Specified by:
processMap in class AbstractMapProcessor
Parameters:
incoming - A record as a Map implementation
Returns:
Object[] with mapped entries.
Throws:
RecordException

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IDataProcessor are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Overrides:
validate in class AbstractMapProcessor
